hanzi-su-wiki:
勅

Значения

Императорский указ

Мнемоника

Указ императора встать на защиту страны, собрав силы 力 в единую связку 束.

Варианты

敕
purpleculture_pinyin:
chì
Japanese variant of 敕 ; imperial decree
Японский вариант 敕; императорский указ
rtega_mnemonic:
敕敕RS
勅勅		imperial decree, daoist magic
  • RS. carry 攵/力 a bag 束: by imperial order
  • the hand 攵 of the emperor writes the order that binds 束 everyone whom it concerns
heisig_constituent: imperial order, bundle, Chaplin, tree, wood, mouth, power, muscle, arnold
heisig_story: In order to keep this character distinct from that for an imperial edict (Frame 366), we must draw again on a pun. Think of the order here as a mail order or an order of pizza phoned in by the Emperor for delivery to the imperial palace. Then it will not be hard to put together bundle and muscle to form a story about an imperial order.
koohiiStory1: This is an imperial order for pizza. To deliver the huge bundle of pizzas to the emperor, the pizza boy needs huge muscles.
koohiiStory2: Imperial order carries quite a bundle of executive power.
kunYomi: いまし.める、みことのり
Ru_Notes: Используется в основном в ряде слов, означающих "нечто, сделанное по велению императора" (поэтическая антология по выбору императора, тронная речь императора, и т.п.).
Ru_Words:
勅みことのり
  • императорский указ (эдикт)
    • 勅問ちょくもん
  • вопрос императора
    • 勅諚ちょくじょう
  • тронная речь, послание императора
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 力 (сила), 口 (рот), 木 (дерево)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you're making a bundle (束) of effort (力) to meet the Imperial Order

勅字的基本解释

勅
chì
同“敕”。

勅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chì］
［《廣韻》恥力切，入職，徹。］
亦作“勅1”。亦作“勑1”。
(1)诫饬；告诫。
(2)古时自上告下之词。汉时凡尊长告诫后辈或下属皆称敕。南北朝以后特指皇帝的诏书。
(3)委任。
(4)指委任状。
(5)道士用于符咒上的命令。
(6)责让。
(7)犹治，理。
(8)整饬。
(9)敬慎。
(10)犹着，穿着。
(11)详明。
(12)姓。见《通志·氏族五》。

勅字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【力字部】　勅； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页147第29
【集韻】蓄力切，音敕。誡也。本作勑。或作飭。

勅字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
勅字的起名意思

暂无。

Imperial
Basic explanation of words
Imperial
chì
Same as "Emperor".
Imperial
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chì］
["Guangyun" is shameful, entertaining, and thorough. ]
Also known as "Imperial 1". Also known as "勑1".
(1) Commandments; warnings.
(2) Words from the top to the bottom in ancient times. The head of Han Shifan warned his descendants or subordinates to be called edicts. After the Northern and Southern Dynasties, it refers specifically to the edicts of the emperor.
(3) Appointment.
(4) Refers to the letter of commission.
(5) Taoist priests use commands on spells.
(6) Responsibility.
(7) Judgment, rationality.
(8) Rectification.
(9) Be cautious.
(10) Still still, dressed.
(11) Detailed description.
(12) Last name. See "Tongzhi·Clan Five".
Imperial
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset 2] [Li Zi Department] 　敕; Kangxi Strokes: 9; Page Number: Page 147 29
[Jiyun] Accumulate power and cut, sound edict. Commandments too. This is 勑. Or as a temple.
